item.description:
This opera has received rave reviews in the New York Times and Wall Street Journal.  The story is Shakespeare's "The Tempest" (those of you who saw the movie, "The Master" may recognize some of the characters).  It's supposed to be superb and HD is the way to see everything, complete with subtitles.  This is the encore performance (I can't attend the original).  I've bought my ticket, so I'm going.  If you want to go, you should get your ticket soon as it usually sells out.

It's 3 hours long but I have a feeling that we'll want to talk about what we've seen.  So I will plan on going for a drink and a snack after.  Looking forward to sharing this experience with all the opera lovers in our group.

Composer Thomas Adès conducts the Metropolitan Opera premiere of his own work, with baritone Simon Keenlyside starring as Prospero. Director Robert Lepage recreates the interior of 18th-century La Scala in this inventive staging.
item.how_to_find_us: I'll be at the ticket taker at 6:00 until 6:10, then will try to find seats.
